conclusion: To determine the car's acceleration from the start of timing, we need to analyze the given x-t (position-time) graph.
The graph shows the relationship between the position x and time t.
The slope of the x-t graph gives the velocity v of the car.
The acceleration a can be found from the velocity-time graph, which is the derivative of the position-time graph.
The x-t graph is a straight line passing through the origin.

premise: The x-t graph is a straight line passing through the origin.
conclusion: This indicates that the velocity is constant.

premise: The slope of the line is the velocity v.
conclusion: The slope of the line in the x-t graph is the change in position divided by the change in time.
From the graph, we can see that the slope is 10 m/s for the positive part and -10 m/s for the negative part.

premise: The slope of the line is the velocity.
conclusion: v = 10 m/s for the positive part and v = -10 m/s for the negative part.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity.

premise: Since the velocity is changing linearly with time, the acceleration is the slope of the velocity-time graph.
conclusion: From the graph, we can see that the slope of the velocity-time graph is the change in velocity divided by the change in time.

premise: The slope of the line is the change in velocity divided by the change in time.

conclusion: Therefore, the car's acceleration from the start of timing is 10 m/s².
